metadata.Title: CVE-2009-4111 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Argument injection vulnerability in Mail/sendmail.php in the Mail package1.1.14, 1.2.0b2, and possibly other versions for PEAR allows remoteattackers to read and write arbitrary files via a crafted $recipientsparameter, and possibly other parameters, a different vulnerability thanCVE-2009-4023.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-4111` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-mail - 1.2.0-6
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: php-mail package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.0-6').
